Snow falls by the Bell Tower on Thursday night as a winter storm warning was in effect for Tippecanoe and surrounding counties PERIOD

A winter storm warning has prompted safety efforts from different departments and organizations at and around Purdue PERIOD

According to Jason Puma a meteorologist for the National Weather Service Lafayette and West Lafayette will receive between  inches of snow by  p.m PERIOD today PERIOD A majority of the snow arrived Thursday evening continuing until around  a.m PERIOD today PERIOD

 Puma said PERIOD

West Lafayette Police are also prepared for any accidents that may come about due to weather changes PERIOD

Chief Jason Dombkowski said they have secured fourwheeldrive vehicles and have been in contact with the departments street commissioners who pretreated the roads PERIOD

 he said PERIOD

Buildings and Grounds at Purdue prepared for the bad weather by having all their equipment ready to go as well as equipping themselves with a big supply of sand and salt PERIOD

 said Scott Helmkamp grounds supervisor for Buildings and Grounds PERIOD 

As far as plowing trucks and their areas Helmkamp said Buildings and Grounds are working with the city on keeping the roads clear PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

Severe weather at Purdue is also addressed by Environmental Health and Public Safety which plans on utilizing the Purdue Alert System to notify students in case of an emergency PERIOD

Ron Wright director of Campus Emergency Preparedness and Planning said they are prepared for notifying and making students aware of the situation if the weather gets worse PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

Wright said the decision on whether or not classes will come to a halt based on the weather is not up to Environmental and Public Safety PERIOD
